title: Berberine's Multi-System Benefits Continue to Impress Researchers
summary: A review of 2 recent animal and review studies on berberine & metabolic health. Related supplements include Berberine, EGCG (Green Tea Extract), Metformin. Here's what the latest science tells us about this important area of longevity research.
body:
## Summary

New research sheds light on **Berberine & Metabolic Health** and its implications for healthy aging. We reviewed 2 recent studies exploring this topic — here's what the science says.


## Key Findings

- **Berberine: A Negentropic Modulator for Multi-System Coordination:** Berberine (BBR), a protoberberine alkaloid with a long history of medicinal use, has consistently demonstrated benefits in glucose-lipid metabolism and inflammatory balance across both preclinical ...
- **Berberine Alleviates Lipopolysaccharide-Induced Acute Lung Injury by Modulating the AMPK-HMGB1-NF...:** The activation of adenosine-monophosphate-activated protein kinase (AMPK) by berberine (BBR) benefits various inflammatory diseases.

## What This Means For You

Berberine continues to demonstrate impressive metabolic benefits, activating AMPK — the body's "metabolic master switch." Often compared to metformin, berberine may support glucose regulation, reduce inflammation, and modulate the gut microbiome. If you're looking for a natural approach to metabolic health, berberine is one of the most evidence-backed options.

## Related Products

- **Berberine** (Grade A) — 500mg 2-3x/day with meals
  *Mechanisms:* AMPK activation, Glucose regulation, Gut microbiome, Lipid metabolism
- **EGCG (Green Tea Extract)** (Grade B) — 400-500mg/day
  *Mechanisms:* Autophagy induction, Antioxidant, Anti-inflammatory, AMPK activation
- **Metformin** (Grade B) — 500-1000mg/day
  *Mechanisms:* AMPK activation, mTOR inhibition, Glucose regulation
